column4: hi there - gparted doesnt seem to have an option for ntfs is there any other program i might use
I think gparted can do ntfs.. you might have to install ntfs-3g first though
had ntfs-3g installed but gparted still doesnt do ntfs
are you trying to format a partition as ntfs?
yes
is the partition unmounted?
on gparted, the menu gparted, click on show features.. is ntfs listed there?
sorry
are you sure you've got ntfs-3g installed?
hmm.. hang on.. let me check something
is FAT16 or FAT32 a bad idea for a drive this large
how large is it?
fat32 should be ok.. it's not perfect but it's ok
fat16 is a very very bad idea
ah.. figured it out.. you need ntfsprogs installed too
checking now
so, sudo apt-get install ntfsprogs, restart gparted and it should be able to do ntfs just fine
- cheers bud works a treat now
you're welcome
one more question should i select create as primary partion or extended
primary unless you have more than 4 partitions on the drive
sure, go with primary
